revised_title: Opisthobranch Molluscs of the British Solomon Islands: Habitat and Habits
tldr: This study examines the habitats and habits of opisthobranch molluscs in the British Solomon Islands. The authors found that these molluscs primarily inhabit two types of reef locations: the crest of a semi-exposed reef and the flat of a sheltered or semi-sheltered reef. They also discovered various feeding habits among the opisthobranch species, including herbivory, carnivory, and specialized diets. The study provides valuable insights into the ecology of these fascinating creatures and their role in coral reef ecosystems.
